page.title: 01The village of Marnhull.
page.content: Marnhull is a large village of some 2000 people.It lies 6 miles SW of Shaftesbury and 3 miles north of Sturminster Newton.It is in the heart of the Blackmore Vale in North Dorset. It lies on a limestone ridge above the River Stour.Its church tower is a landmark over many miles.It is in an area of rich pastureland and dairy farming predominates.New estates have been added in recent years to the older village houses some of which are thatched.Many choose to retire here- over 50% of the population have retired.Skilled snd professional people in particular choose to live here with Plessey Marine at Templecombe and Westland Engineering at Yeovil providing employment. There are 2 primary schools,3 active chuches,3 pubs,several shops and 2 banks.Marnhull is Hardy's Marlott.
